body.name: WOODYNLUX Computer Desk with Shelves, 43 Inch Gaming Writing Desk, Study PC Table Workstation with Storage for Home Office, Living Room, Bedroom, Metal Frame, Rustic.
features: 【DESIGNED FOR MULTI-PURPOSE】Size: 19.7"D x 43.3"W x 29.5"H. Weight:29lbs. This computer desk provides with a large enough space for work and study that makes it a perfect choice for a study desk, computer desk, home office desk, gaming desk.
【SAFE DESIGN】Mooth Angle of The desktop is safer for your family , to prevent collisions due to accidents, therefore, this writing table is also very good choice for students.

【LARGE MONITOR SHELF】Equipped with an oversized monitor shelf, 37.8"* 7.9" of surface area and a non-slip pad at the bottom of the monitor stand can easily accommodate two monitors and maintain high stability.
【BOTTOM SHELF DESIGN】The bottom bookshelf design of this computer desk offers ample storage space for books, files, and other office home supplies.

【STURDY STABLE FOR USE】Made of sturdy metal frame and strong particleboard, it's stability and practicality for the home office desk. Adjustable leg pads keep the desk stable and prevent your floor from being scratched.
【DURABLE】 The desktop is made of a waterproof, scratch-proof, easy-to-clean, safe and Eco-friendly MDF material so that this workstation can accompany you for years.

【EASY ASSEMBLELY】This writing desk will provide detailed installation steps and instructions. The accessories and necessary installation tools are all included, which will make installation process simple and pleasant. That would be easily completed by one person within 15min.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: UNDER DESK STORAGE SHELF DURABLE DESK ADJUSTABLE LEG PADS

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s exactly what I needed! Perfect size, sturdy, easy to put together. Even came with a little screw driver! Put it together in no time. It’s not too big, not too small. The shelves on the top is easy to remove if you don’t need it. The white marble is so cute :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Near-Perfect Desk; Sturdy, Practical and Looks Great.
reviews.reviewText: A week in, I love this desk. It fits perfectly in the corner (measurements accurate), and that I'm not worried to leave all my things and gear on it. The fact the monitor stand is removable but so sturdy is a god-send; being a mixed-media and digital artist, I can change my setup easily without worries. Rounded edges save me from injury each time. If I move out, I will bring this exact desk with me or buy the same one.-----More info on material and assembly:Upon first impression, the materials felt weighty and good quality; there was some slight surface damage on some of the metal pieces but once assembled, they are out of sight. The finish of the wood was nicer than I was expecting, it is a little cooler than the photos (I was choosing between beech or grey, and reading recent reviews, I made the right decision).For assembly, it took two people and a little over an hour. The instructions were pretty straight forward, but there were instances we thought we were wrong because some of the screws wouldn't secure in the holes smoothly. Also the extra pieces confused us, but I am grateful to have them, just in case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Looks great, Perfect size.
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for small areas. Lots of desktop space to work on. Very sturdy. Looks great.Directions on assembly could be better. Saying that, Font should be larger.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great desk for the price
reviews.reviewText: So I got my first PC setup thanks to my partner, and thus I had to get a desk. We are in a minuscule apartment, so space saving and inexpensive was the goal. Luckily, I found this listing. It wasn’t too heavy to bring up, definitely something that’ll make you a little sweaty but not in need of a helper (though take that as you will, it may still be too heavy to bring up on your own).The wood material is pretty light, the metal legs were the heaviest part. The instructions are completely picture-based, no descriptions besides the numbers corresponding to the pieces. All the hardware is in numbered bags, so I highly recommend keeping the individual pieces in their numbered baggies and taking them out one by one to avoid confusion. That being said, there was a part in the instruction booklet where the picture was so small I had to be really careful with putting the second shelf together, but otherwise it was very easy to put together. I even had extra hardware left over, which are now tucked away in a junk drawer in their numbered baggies.I’m about a month and a half in, and I’m really impressed with it. I’m not a heavy-duty gamer or whatever, so I’m not on this thing 24/7 for gaming. I have a dual monitor set up, and I found it best for myself to not use the second unattached shelf to house the monitors, but if you’re taller than me it’ll be beneficial to you. Yes, it is free floating and not physically attached to the desk, but it’s easy enough to fix with a few strips of duct tape to help give it some traction (otherwise it’s smooth wood on smooth wood).The shelf underneath the desk that is physically attached is a rather nice footrest. You can’t put too much weight on it, but (I hope) no one plans to stand on it so it doesn’t matter. Because I went with the black color option, I did find that it leaves slight scuff marks on my wall, but if you can spend another $2-3, then you can get those small felt furniture disk things that go under the legs of you chair to stop it from scuffing the floor. I just cut one in half, stuck it to the back and sides that meet the wall, and the problem was solved.This is a great desk for computers, general desk work, studying, art, whatever you need. It’s deep enough that I’m not fighting for space for my arms or keyboard or whatever, but it still doesn’t take up much space in my tiny overpriced apartment. I hope you like it too, if you get it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive, simple, functional desk
reviews.reviewText: I really like this desk. It has a no nonsense design and is easy to assemble. There was even a screwdriver in the box to assemble it with. Highly recommend if you want a plain, modern and useful desk that won't break the bank. It's nice looking too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice looking desk
reviews.reviewText: It is very aesthetically pleasing, extremely sturdy and not too hard to assemble. It took 2 people around a half hour and was pretty easy. The monitor stand is not connected to the main part of the desk, so beware of that. The height and width is good for small spaces. I have used it for gaming and schoolwork and it is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars easy cute small desk
reviews.reviewText: Easy to assemble great for a small space and very sturdy !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what we needed
reviews.reviewText: Small desk but fits 2 monitors, laptop and keyboard. Easy to put together and seems pretty sturdy!
